Detailed Description

Represents a 2 dimensional vector.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

chaos::gfx::Vector2::Vector2 ( )

Default constructor.

Creates a new Vector2 with the x and y components initialised as 0.

chaos::gfx::Vector2::Vector2 ( float  x,
float  y 
)

Component constructor.

Creates a new Vector2 with the given x any y component values.

chaos::gfx::Vector2::Vector2 ( float  scalar)

Scalar constructor.

Creates a new Vector2 with both the x and y components initialised to the given scalar.

chaos::gfx::Vector2::Vector2 ( const Vector2 &  other)

Copy constructor.

Creates a copy of the given Vector2.

Member Function Documentation

Vector2& chaos::gfx::Vector2::operator= ( const Vector2 &  other)

Assignment operator.

Assigns the values of this Vector2 to be a copy of the values of the other given Vector2.

Parameters
otherVector2 to copy data from.
Returns
A reference to this Vector2 once the assignment has taken place.
bool chaos::gfx::Vector2::operator== ( const Vector2 &  other) const

Equality operator.

Compares whether this Vector2 and the other given Vector2 are considered "equal". A comparison of the components of the vector is performed using chaos::math::float_equals using the default values for delta_threshold and ulps_threshold.

Parameters
otherVector2 to compare this vector against.
Returns
Whether the vectors are considered equal.
bool chaos::gfx::Vector2::operator!= ( const Vector2 &  other) const

Inequality operator.

Compares whether this Vector2 and the other given Vector2 are not considered "equal". See Vector2::operator== for further information.

Parameters
otherVector2 to compare this vector against.
Returns
Whether the vectors are not considered equal.
